item-comm-1-4.title: Greetings Quiz
item-comm-1-4.description: Test your knowledge of English greetings

quizQuestions.question: Which greeting is most appropriate for a formal business meeting?
quizQuestions.explanation: 'Good morning, how are you?' is the most appropriate formal greeting for business settings.

quizQuestions.question: What is the correct response to 'How do you do?'
quizQuestions.explanation: The formal response to 'How do you do?' is to repeat 'How do you do?' back.

quizQuestions.question: Which phrase is used when meeting someone for the first time?
quizQuestions.explanation: 'Nice to meet you' is the standard phrase when being introduced to someone new.

item-comm-1-5.title: Homework: Self-Introduction Recording
item-comm-1-5.instructions:
Create a 2-minute video introducing yourself in English.

Include:
1. Your name and where you're from
2. Your hobbies and interests
3. Why you want to learn English
4. Your goals for this course

Speak clearly and naturally. Don't read from a script!

item-comm-2-4.title: Daily Conversations Quiz
item-comm-2-4.description: Test your knowledge of everyday English

quizQuestions.question: How do you politely ask for the bill at a restaurant?
options: Could I have the check, please?
quizQuestions.explanation: 'Could I have the check, please?' is the polite way to ask for the bill.

quizQuestions.question: What does 'How much is this?' mean?
quizQuestions.explanation: 'How much is this?' is asking about the price of an item.

item-comm-3-1.title: Expressing Agreement & Disagreement
item-comm-3-1.description: Learn phrases to agree and disagree politely

item-comm-3-3.title: Homework: Opinion Essay
item-comm-3-3.description: Write a short essay expressing your opinion
item-comm-3-3.instructions:
Write a 300-word essay on one of these topics:

1. Should students wear school uniforms?
2. Is social media good for society?
3. Should homework be banned?

Use opinion phrases from the lesson:
- In my opinion...
- I strongly believe that...
- From my point of view...

quizQuestions.question: Which is the most professional email greeting?
quizQuestions.explanation: 'Dear Mr. Smith,' is the most professional email greeting.

quizQuestions.question: What does 'ASAP' stand for?
quizQuestions.explanation: ASAP means 'As Soon As Possible' - a common business abbreviation.

item-biz-2-1.title: Professional Email Writing
item-biz-2-1.description: Structure and tone of business emails

item-biz-2-3.title: Homework: Write a Business Email
item-biz-2-3.description: Compose a professional email based on a scenario
item-biz-2-3.instructions:
Write a professional email for the following scenario:

You need to request a meeting with your manager to discuss a project deadline extension.

Your email should include:
1. A professional greeting
2. Clear purpose statement
3. Reason for the request
4. Proposed new deadline
5. Professional closing

Word limit: 150-200 words

item-biz-3-2.title: Meeting Vocabulary & Phrases
item-biz-3-2.description: Essential language for leading and participating in meetings

item-biz-3-3.title: Homework: Mini Presentation
item-biz-3-3.description: Prepare and record a 3-minute business presentation
item-biz-3-3.instructions:
Prepare a 3-minute presentation on ONE of these topics:

1. Introduce your company/dream company
2. Present a product idea
3. Explain a business process

Requirements:
- Clear introduction and conclusion
- At least 3 main points
- Use presentation phrases from the lesson
- Record yourself presenting

Submit the video recording.
